org.hps.recon.ecal

Class EcalOnlineRawConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.recon.ecal.EcalOnlineRawConverter

  • public class EcalOnlineRawConverter
extends Object
    EcalOnlineRawConverter handles the conversion of raw hits of all modes to energy hit CalorimeterHit objects. This converter will employ the runtime values for all parameters and is intended to emulate the firmware specifically.

    The converter requires the presence of the DAQ configuration manager, which is activated by either DatabaseDAQConfigDriver or DAQConfigDriver depending on from where it is to obtain the configuration.

    This converter is primarily employed in the trigger and hardware diagnostic processes as well as the readout simulation in Monte Carlo.

    • Method Detail

      • getPulsePedestal

        public int getPulsePedestal(long cellID,
                            int windowSamples,
                            int thresholdCrossing)
        Gets the pedestal for a given crystal and threshold crossing.
        Parameters:
        cellID - - The cell ID of the crystal.
        windowSamples - - The size of the readout window. A value of -1 indicates an infinite readout window.
        thresholdCrossing - - The time of the threshold crossing in 4-nanosecond clock-cycles (samples).
        Returns:
        Returns the pedestal for the crystal and threshold crossing.

      • HitDtoA

        public List<CalorimeterHit> HitDtoA(RawTrackerHit hit)
        Converts a mode-1 digitized waveform into standard energy hit.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The "hit" object representing the digitized waveform for a given crystal.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of CalorimeterHit objects parsed from the waveform.

      • HitDtoA

        public CalorimeterHit HitDtoA(RawCalorimeterHit hit,
                              double timeOffset)
        Converts a raw mode-3 hit to a proper calorimeter hit in units of energy.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The raw hit that is to be converted.
        timeOffset - - The time offset for the hit.
        Returns:
        Returns a CalorimeterHit hit object that represents the raw mode-3 hit with units of energy and a correct time-stamp.

      • HitDtoA

        public CalorimeterHit HitDtoA(RawCalorimeterHit hit,
                              GenericObject mode7Data,
                              double timeOffset)
        Converts a raw mode-7 hit to a proper calorimeter hit in units of energy.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The raw hit that is to be converted.
        mode7Data - - Additional mode-7 data object.
        timeOffset - - The time offset for the hit.
        Returns:
        Returns a CalorimeterHit hit object that represents the raw mode-7 hit with units of energy and a correct time-stamp.

      • adcToEnergy

        private double adcToEnergy(int adcSum,
                           long cellID)
        Converts a value in ADC in a crystal to energy in units of GeV.
        Parameters:
        adcSum - - The ADC value to convert.
        cellID - - The cell ID of the crystal containing the value.
        Returns:
        Returns the ADC value as an energy in units of GeV.

      • convertWaveformToPulse

        private int[] convertWaveformToPulse(short[] waveform,
                                     int thresholdCrossing)
        Converts a mode-1 digitized waveform to a mode-3/7 pulse for a a given threshold crossing.
        Parameters:
        waveform - - The digitized waveform. Each array value should correspond to a sample of the waveform in units of ADC.
        thresholdCrossing - - The time of the threshold crossing in samples.
        Returns:
        Returns a double primitive of size 2. The first value represents the time in nanoseconds of the pulser and the second value the total integrated value of the pulse in ADC.

      • setUseConstantWindow

        void setUseConstantWindow(boolean state)
        Sets whether to use a constant integration window for the the purpose of determining the correct pedestal. This should be used in conjunction with Monte Carlo data during the readout cycle.
        Parameters:
        state - - true ignores the size of the readout window when calculating pedestals, and false accounts for it in the case of pulse-clipping.
